intro: Urostigma fuscescens, commonly known as the blackleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a dark green color with a slightly rough texture. Urostigma fuscescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
